info.author: Niklas Siedhoff & Alexander-Maurice Illig
info.name: pypef
info.summary: A CLI tool (not intended for API use) for performing data-driven protein engineering by building machine learning models from sequence variant-fitness data (e.g., provided as CSV data).
info.yanked_reason: Version has strict third-party package dependencies

urls.yanked_reason: Version has strict third-party package dependencies
Version has strict third-party package dependencies

info.author: Niklas Siedhoff & Alexander-Maurice Illig
info.name: pypef
info.summary: A command-line interface tool for performing data-driven protein engineering by building machine learning models from sequence variant-fitness data (e.g., provided as CSV data).Get the API for encoding with: from pypef import encoding_api.

info.author: Niklas Siedhoff & Alexander-Maurice Illig
info.name: pypef
info.summary: A command-line interface tool for performing data-driven protein engineering by building machine learning models from sequence variant-fitness data (e.g., provided as CSV data).Get the small API provided for encoding with: from pypef import encoding_api

info.author: Niklas Siedhoff & Alexander-Maurice Illig
info.name: pypef
info.summary: A command-line interface (CLI) tool for performing data-driven protein engineering by building machine learning models from sequence variant-fitness data (e.g., provided as CSV data). Get a small API provided for encoding and model validation from modules in pypef.api.

info.author: Niklas Siedhoff & Alexander-Maurice Illig
info.name: pypef
info.summary: A command-line interface (CLI) tool for performing data-driven protein engineering by building machine learning (ML)-trained regression models from sequence variant fitness data (in CSV format) based on different techniques for protein sequence encoding. Next to building pure ML models, 'hybrid modeling' is also possible using a blended model optimized for predictive contributions of a statistical and an ML-based prediction.

Next to building pure ML models, 'hybrid modeling' is also possible using a blended model optimized for predictive contributions of a statistical and an ML-based prediction.
